alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 4:34PM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Northern Ventura County. * WHEN...Until 615 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 PM PDT, Heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms has ended, but arroyo and small stream flooding with water flowing through normally dry drainages is possible through 615 pm. Water may be flowing across mountain roadways, even though rain may not be falling. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lockwood Valley, Alamo Mountain, Frazier Mountain and Reyes Peak. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent of low-lying areas and low water crossings. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
